intro: Sisymbrium pallescens, commonly known as hoary whitlowgrass, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and linear leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, round seeds that are dispersed by wind, and it is often found in disturbed soils. Sisymbrium pallescens is a hardy perennial that can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
